question.body: Sympathetic signals to smooth muscles of blood vessels of arms and legs will be sent via which neurotransmitters?

response.feedback: Correct. The preganglionic neuron always releases ACh, and, in the sympathetic division, the postganglionic neuron releases epinephrine.
Incorrect. Both of these are chemically similar, but not released by any autonomic presynaptic (preganglionic) neurons.
Incorrect. One of these is correct, but remember sympathetic uses a different neurotransmitter from postsynaptic neuron to effector.
Incorrect. What neurotransmitter is released by all presynaptic neurons in the autonomic nervous system, and what is the sympathetic neurotransmitter?
